block.p: A group of people involved in the occult who stole a skull from a crypt in Passaic County last year didn't get away with their macabre scheme, but once they were caught, police found they could be charged only with a disorderly persons charge of vandalism. Assembly Majority Leader Paul DiGaetano, Republican of Passaic, is the sponsor of a bill released unanimously by the Assembly Judiciary Committee last week that would make grave robbing, and unlawfully entering a tomb, a crime with a penalty of up to 10 years in prison and a fine of up to $150,000.

A group of people involved in the occult who stole a skull from a crypt in Passaic County last year didn't get away with their macabre scheme, but once they were caught, police found they could be charged only with a disorderly persons charge of vandalism. Assembly Majority Leader Paul DiGaetano, Republican of Passaic, is the sponsor of a bill released unanimously by the Assembly Judiciary Committee last week that would make grave robbing, and unlawfully entering a tomb, a crime with a penalty of up to 10 years in prison and a fine of up to $150,000.
